phase.title: Childhood
phase.events:
2035: Tír Tairngire secedes from SSC; CFS kicked out of UCAS 2036: TT invades northern CFS to Redding 2041-2044: Nationalist War in China 2042: Liu's parents emigrate from Beijing to TT 2046-05-08 17:15:12 -0700: Liu born in Cara'Sir (Portland), TT Both parents are 1st Generation Han Chinese Elves who emigrated from greater Beijing to Tír Tairngire, motivated by the welcoming-to-metahumans rhetoric of TT's founding and the unrest in China at that time.
Under Tír Tairngire's autocratic government, Martin was a member of the Rinelle ke'Tesrae's moderate/liberal wing, favoring democratic elections and a reduction/elimination of the formal caste system. Since the elections of 2065, he eschews revolutionary action in favor of "within the system" reforms. He has no particular admiration for the previous unelected Princes, and adheres to no significant racism directed at either metatypes or ethnic backgrounds, thereby opposing the Elf supremacist factions in the Rinelle [LOP7-8/SofNA142-3]. His family spoke mainly 普通话 at home. His true native language is now Sperethiel, and he has a strong non-native command of English.

phase.title: Early Adulthood
phase.events: 2064: Liu undergoes Rite of Passage [TT57]. For the Bridging portion, he went to Anthony Lakes, Whitman National Forest in Northeastern Tír Tairngire. Tír Tairngirenes can be issued their standard Peace Force survival knife before deferred military service so they can use it in the Bridging, as Liu did. For the Naming portion, he chose to replace his birth name Resperentish with Imiritish ke'Tolosa, and made appropriate democratic reforms to the usual declarations of loyalty, cf. Reconstructionist Judaic bar mitzvah. 2065: 1st open TT elections, Larry Zincan elected High Prince. Liu voted for him. 2067: PCC absorbs Ute nation w/much Ute unrest 2068: Martin gets B.A. in Applied Thaumaturgy from UTT in Serentaneyo (Eugene), starts mandatory 2-year military service in Border Patrol. Liu served as a Lt. in the Border Patrol due to his parents being Chivalry rank [TT59].

phase.title: The Near-Present
phase.events:
2070: 2nd open TT elections, Zincan re-elected. Liu votes for him as High Prince again. Of the other Princes, he has spoken most approvingly of Jake Foster & Amy Joubert [LOP14], with some support as well for Conall Taylor [LOP15]. 4th Rite of Progression held, Liu does not participate due to extended wilderness/border assignments for his military service, which he completes later that year.
2072: M.A. in Applied Thaumaturgy from UTT in Serentaneyo (Eugene); Liu moves to Tarislar, Puyallup [Seattle126]. Lives a Low lifestyle near the hospital Deireadh an Tuartheil, "The End of the Song of the People/Tribe" [Seattle128, SS:HSLL12-13], where he volunteers with Health spells.

character.notes:
Spellcaster notes: Keep it loose. Just do the Four Actions via the new Magic Skill, and give narrative description according to the particular Shadowrun spell desired. I figure a pretty loose definition of the stunt is OK, since it requires a completely new skill (Magic), burns a Stunt in addition to the required Magician extra, AND requires in-game narrative justification from the player.
The particulars of each spell will be largely up to the caster. Some specific patterns (such as Attacks via mana spells being Opposed with Will; physical spells with Physique) will be fairly typical.
Spirit Summoner notes: Can petition the Celestial Bureaucracy for magical favors. Again, keep it loose, and use the new Magic Skill. Maybe start with Creating the "Owes Service to [me]" Advantage on a specific Spirit that provides Active Opposition with its highest-rated Skill. Spending an action to Create more Advantages simply adds more invocations (i.e., services). The narrative particulars depend on the specific type of Spirit, etc.
Drain: Use the options for Extra Effort and Extreme Effort from Fate System Toolkit, trading stress and/or consequences for bonuses.
For even more detail, we could define the 五行 tradition as a character via the Fate Fractal.
